entry.title: Details for "Least-Squares Prices of Games"
entry.summary: This paper is intended to help the readers to understand the article: Y. Hirashita, Least-Squares Prices of Games, Preprint (arXiv:math.OC/0703079).

entry.title: An Algebraic Perspective of Group Relaxations
entry.summary: This is an expository article on recent developments in the theory of group relaxations in integer programming from an algebraic perspective.

entry.title: Performance Evaluation of Switched Discrete Event Systems
entry.summary: This paper discusses the asymptotic periodic behavior of a class of switched discrete event systems, and shows how to evaluate the asymptotic performance of such systems.

entry.title: Edge Theorem for Multivariable Systems
entry.summary: This paper studies robustness of multivariable systems with parametric uncertainties, and establishes a multivariable version of Edge Theorem. An illustrative example is presented.

entry.title: Pseudopolynomial algorithm for single machine scheduling (withdrawn)
entry.summary: Withdrawn because of non-correctness. Would have implied too much to be true :-|

entry.title: Dynamic programming in mixed continuous-discrete time scales
entry.summary: We obtain the dynamic programming equations and optimality conditions akin to Pontryagin's extremum principle for certain mathematical models of hybrid control systems.

entry.title: Shape Optimization of Transfer Functions
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn due to its publication

entry.title: Lyapunov Theorems for Systems Described by Retarded Functional Differential Equations
entry.summary: Lyapunov-like characterizations for non-uniform in time and uniform robust global asymptotic stability of uncertain systems described by retarded functional differential equations are provided.

entry.title: Null-Controllability of 1-D parabolic equations
entry.summary: We prove the interior null-controllability of one-dimensional parabolic equations with time independent measurable coefficients.

entry.title: Well-posedness of constrained minimization problems via saddle-points
entry.summary: In this paper, it is proved a very general well-posedness result for a class of constrained minimization problems.

entry.title: Equivalence for Differential Equations
entry.summary: We shall study the equivalence problem for ordinary differential equations with respect to the affine transformations group.

entry.title: Quantitative Stability Estimate of the Hardy-Littlewood Functional Under Constraints
entry.summary: We prove the uniqueness of the maximizers of a Hardy-Littlewood type functional under constraints. We also establish a quantitative stability estimate. Introduction

entry.title: Vector variational principle
entry.summary: A vector variational principle is proved.

entry.title: Lasry-Lions regularization and a Lemma of Ilmanen
entry.summary: We provide a full self-contained proof of a famous Lemma of Ilmanen. This proof is based on a regularisation procedure similar to Lasry-Lions regularisation.

entry.title: Decision Making: Lexicographical Procedure
entry.summary: It is introduced the using of generation lexicographical procedure for multicriteria decision-making problems.

entry.title: Decision Making: system lexicon
entry.summary: There is given the program realization system "lexicon" by the using lexicographical procedure.

entry.title: Remark on the Smale's Problem 9
entry.summary: We consider the S.Smale's 9th problem on feasibility of the linear system of inequalities in connection with a linear programming problem.

entry.title: Weak convergence on Douglas-Rachford method
entry.summary: We prove that the sequences generate by the Douglas-Rachford method converge weakly to a solution of the inclusion problem

entry.title: KYP Lemma for Non-Strict Inequalities and the associated Minimax Theorem
entry.summary: Several variations of the classical Kalman-Yakubovich-Popov Lemma, as well the associated minimax theorem are presented.

entry.title: Best $\ell_1$-approximation of nonnegative polynomials by sums of squares
entry.summary: Given a nonnegative polynomial f, we provide an explicit expression for its best $\ell_1$-norm approximation by a sum of squares of given degree.

entry.title: An infinite-horizon optimal control problem and the stability of the adjoint variable (in Russian)
entry.summary: In an infinite-horizon optimal control problem the stability of the adjoint variable implying the vanishing of the adjoint variable at infinity along optimal solution.

entry.title: Optimal adaptive control of cascading power grid failures
entry.summary: We present theoretical results and experiments with parallel algorithms for computing an adaptive, online control with the objective of attenuating a power grid cascading failure.

entry.title: Sparse Recovery, Kashin Decomposition and Conic Programming
entry.summary: We produce relaxation bounds on the diameter of arbitrary sections of the l1 ball in R^n. We use these results to test conditions for sparse recovery.

entry.title: Internal stabilization of the Oseen-Stokes equations by Stratonovich noise
entry.summary: One designs an internal Stratonovich noise feedback controller which exponentially stabilizes the staedy state solutions to Oseen-Stokes equations.

entry.title: Solving Linear Problems with Finite Precision III: Sharp Expectation Bounds
entry.summary: We prove an O(log n) bound for the expectation of the logarithm of the condition number K for the computation of optimizers of linear programs.

entry.title: Iterative reconstruction methods for wave equations
entry.summary: Some iterative techniques are defined to solve reversible inverse problems and a common formulation is explained. Numerical improvements are suggested and tests validate the methods.

entry.title: Negative Curvature and Second-order optimality for regularized SQP
entry.summary: Negative Curvature and Second-order optimality for regularized SQP

entry.title: Control of Nonholonomic Systems and Sub-Riemannian Geometry
entry.summary: Lectures given at the CIMPA School "Geometrie sous-riemannienne", Beirut, Lebanon, 2012

entry.title: New results on equilibria of fuzzy abstract economies
entry.summary: We obtain new equilibrium theorems for fuzzy abstract economies with correspondences being w-upper semicontinuous or having e-USS-property.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages. arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1303.6979

entry.title: On Carnot algebra with the growth vector (2,3,5,8)
entry.summary: We compute two vector field models of the Carnot algebra with the growth vector (2,3,5,8), and an infinitesimal symmetry of the corresponding sub-Riemannian structure.

entry.title: Some open problems
entry.summary: We discuss some challenging open problems in the geometric control theory and sub-Riemannian geometry.

entry.title: The Hautus Test and Genericity Results for Controllable and Uncontrollable Behaviors
entry.summary: This paper generalizes the classical Hautus Test to systems described by partial differential equations.

entry.title: Model Predictive Regulation
entry.summary: We show how optimal nonlinear regulation can be achieved in a model predictive control fashion.

entry.title: Calculations for OPF with Adjustable Tap Ratios
entry.summary: In this document, the calculations of the AC power balance and flow equations used by MATPOWER will be extended to include adjustable tap ratios.

entry.title: A geometric control proof of linear Franks' lemma for geodesic flows
entry.summary: We provide an elementary proof of the Franks lemma for geodesic flows that uses basic tools of geometric control theory.

entry.title: Monge Problem on infinite dimensional Hilbert space endowed with suitable Gaussian measure
entry.summary: In this paper we solve the Monge problem on infinite dimensional Hilbert space endowed with a suitable Gaussian measure, that satisfies the Lebesgue differentiation theorem.

entry.title: Characterizations of objective sets and objective functions
entry.summary: In this short note we give characterizations for objective sets and objective functions as defined in D. Y. Gao and C. Wu's paper arxiv:1104.2970v2.

entry.title: On linear relaxations of OPF problems
entry.summary: We present lifted linear relaxations of the OPF problem.

entry.title: Boundary stabilization of parabolic nonlinear equations
entry.summary: Stabilization of equilibrium solution to parabolic like equations via proportional boundary feedbacks.

entry.title: Dimension of gram spectrahedra of univariate polynomials
entry.summary: The Gram Spectrahedron of a polynomial parametrizes its sums-of-squares representations. In this note, we determine the dimension of Gram Spectrahedra of univariate polynomials.

entry.title: Local Versus Global Conditions in Polynomial Optimization
entry.summary: This paper reviews local and global optimality conditions in polynomial optimization. We summarize the relationship between them.

entry.title: Notes on optimality conditions using Newton diagrams and sums of squares
entry.summary: We consider relationships between optimality conditions using Newton diagrams and sums of squares of polynomials and power series.

entry.title: A note on the reachability of a Fibonacci control system
entry.summary: Motivated by applications in robotics, we investigate a discrete control system related Fibonacci sequence and we characterize its reachable set.

entry.title: Strong NP-hardness of AC power flows feasibility
entry.summary: We present a rigorous proof of strong NP-hardness of the AC-OPF problem.

entry.title: Why does Monte Carlo fail to work properly in high-dimensional optimization problems?
entry.summary: The paper proposes an answer to the question formulated in the title.

entry.title: Reproducing kernel method for PDE constrained optimization
entry.summary: This paper presents reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces method to obtain the numerical solution for partial differential equation constrained optimization problem.

entry.title: Subderivative-subdifferential duality formula
entry.summary: We provide a formula linking the radial subderivative to other subderivatives and subdifferentials for arbitrary extended real-valued lower semicontinuous functions.

entry.title: Phragmén's sequential method with a variance criterion
entry.summary: A variant of Phragm\'en's method for proportional representation via approval voting is briefly explored. Instead of D'Hondt's rule, this variant generalizes Sainte-Lagu\"e's rule.

entry.title: An axiomatic basis for Blackwell optimality
entry.summary: This paper provides an axiomatic basis for Blackwell optimality in discrete-time Markov decision processes with finite state and action spaces.

entry.title: On Directional Derivatives for cone-convex funtions
entry.summary: We investigate the relationship between the existence of directional derivatives for cone-convex functions with values in a Banach space Y and isomorphisms between Y and c0.

entry.title: Integral functionals on Sobolev spaces having multiple local minima
entry.summary: In this paper, two multiplicity results about local minima of integrals of the calculus of variations are established. The main tool used to prove them is the theory developed in [B. Ricceri, Sublevel sets and global minima of coercive functionals and local minima of their pertubations, math.OC/0402444].
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Variational analysis and applications, 953--961, Nonconvex Optim. Appl., 79, Springer, New York, 2005

entry.title: Duality between Multidimensional Convolutional Codes and Systems
entry.summary: Multidimensional convolutional codes generalize (one dimensional) convolutional codes and they correspond under a natural duality to multidimensional systems widely studied in the systems literature.

entry.title: Mathematical Problems in the Control of Underactuated Systems
entry.summary: In this paper we will discuss problems and techniques related to underactuated systems. We give a mathematical formulation of several problems arising from applications, review some standard and new techniques, and pose some interesting and challenging open questions.

entry.title: A Convex Maximization Problem: Continuous Case
entry.summary: We study a specific convex maximization problem in the space of continuous functions defined on a semi-infinite interval. An unexplained connection to the discrete version of this problem is investigated.

entry.title: Matching control laws for a ball and beam system
entry.summary: This note describes a method for generating an infinite-dimensional family of nonlinear control laws for underactuated systems. For a ball and beam system, the entire family is found explicitly.

entry.title: The Calibration Method for Free Discontinuity Problems
entry.summary: The calibration method is used to identify some minimizers of the Mumford-Shah functional. The method is then extended to more general free discontinuity problems.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the 3rd European Congress of Mathematics (Barcelona, 2000)

entry.title: Stability of Polytopic Polynomial Matrices
entry.summary: This paper gives a necessary and sufficient condition for robust D-stability of Polytopic Polynomial Matrices. Edge theorem is extended to multi-input-multi-output case.

entry.title: A Recipe for Construction of the Critical Vertices for Left-Sector Stability of Interval Polynomials
entry.summary: For the left-sector stability of interval polynomials, it suffices to check a subset of its vertex polynomials. This paper provides a recipe for construction of these critical vertices. Illustrative examples are presented.

entry.title: Controllability of reduced systems
entry.summary: Sufficient conditions for the controllability of a conservative reduced system are given. Several examples illustrating the theory are also presented.

entry.title: A smooth variant of the Afriat- Varian Theorem
entry.summary: We present a simple geometric construction for smoothing polyhedral utility functions. Keywords: Afriat- Varian theorem, the utility function, the economic indices theory, convex analysis.

entry.title: Gradient algorithms for finding common Lyapunov functions
entry.summary: This paper is concerned with the problem of finding a quadratic common Lyapunov function for a family of stable linear systems. We present gradient iteration algorithms which give deterministic convergence for finite system families and probabilistic convergence for infinite families.

entry.title: Improved Results on Robust Stability of Multivariable Interval Control Systems
entry.summary: For interval polynomial matrices, we identify the minimal testing set, whose stability can guarantee that of the whole uncertain set. Our results improve the conclusions given by Kamal and Dahleh.

entry.title: H-infinity Performance of Interval Systems
entry.summary: In this paper, we study $H^{\infty}$ performance of interval systems. We prove that, for an interval system, the maximal $H^{\infty}$ norm of its sensitivity function is achieved at twelve (out of sixteen) Kharitonov vertices.

entry.title: A Numerical Approach for Designing Unitary Space Time Codes with Large Diversity
entry.summary: A numerical approach to design unitary constellation for any dimension and any transmission rate under non-coherent Rayleigh flat fading channel.

entry.title: A duality theory for some non-convex functions of matrices
entry.summary: We study a special class of non-convex functions which appear in nonlinear elasticity; and we prove that they have well-defined Legandre transforms. Several examples are given, and an application to a nonlinear eigenvalue problem

entry.title: Minimum Ellipsoid Bounds for Solutions of Polynomial Systems via Sum of Squares
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to its publication

entry.title: On the rate of convergence of finite-difference approximations for Bellman equations with Lipschitz coefficients
entry.summary: We consider parabolic Bellman equations with Lipschitz coefficients. Error bounds of order $h^{1/2}$ for certain types of finite-difference schemes are obtained.

entry.title: A further improvement of a minimax theorem of Borenshtein and Shulman
entry.summary: I do improve a recent improvement (due to Saint Raymond) of a minimax theorem of Borenshtein and Shul'man, replacing a global compactness assumption by a local one.

entry.title: The Logarithmic Spiral Conjecture
entry.summary: When searching for a planar line, if given no further information, one should adopt a logarithmic spiral strategy (although unproven).

entry.title: A Remark on Monotone I/O Systems
entry.summary: This note remarks that small-gain results for a negative feedback loop around a monotone system can be seen as consequences of results concerning an extended monotone system.

entry.title: Trading Strategy Adipted Optimization of European Call Option
entry.summary: Optimal pricing of European call option is described by linear stochastic differential equation. Trading strategy given by a twin of stochastic variables was integrated w.r.t. Black-Scholes formula to adopt optimal pricing to tarading strategy.

entry.title: Uniqueness properties of functionals with Lipschitzian derivative
entry.summary: We prove that a functional with Lipschitzian derivative, when restricted to suitable spheres centered at a noncritical point, has a unique maximum.

entry.title: Stasis Points and Approximating Two-Cycles
entry.summary: Generically, every fixed point for the differential inclusion x' in ConvexHull{f_1,f_2} can be approximated by an arbitrarily small two-cycle for the inclusion x' in {f_1,f_2}, where f_1, f_2 are a C^1 flows on R^n.

entry.title: Correctness of the optimal control problems for distributed parameter systems (survey)
entry.summary: Here an original idea is suggested to prove the existence of optimal control for some types of non- linear problems. The obtained results can be considered as individual existence theorems (in some sense).

entry.title: Transport and Concentration Problems with Interaction Effects
entry.summary: After presenting an overview about variational problems on probability measures for functionals involving transport costs and extra terms encouraging or discouraging concentration, we look for optimality conditions, regularity properties and explicit computations in the case where Wasserstein distances and interaction energies are considered.

entry.title: Global optimization: algorithms and software
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: The cost of approximate controllability for semilinear heat equations in one space dimension
entry.summary: This paper deals with the approximate controllability for the semilinear heat equation in one space dimension. Our aim is to provide an estimate of the cost of the control.

entry.title: Global Minimization of Rational Functions and the Nearest GCDs
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to its publication

entry.title: Reduction of Linear Programming to Linear Approximation
entry.summary: It is well known that every Chebyshev linear approximation problem can be reduced to a linear program. In this paper we show that conversely every linear program can be reduced to a Chebyshev linear approximation problem.

entry.title: Generalized rank-constrained matrix approximations
entry.summary: In this paper we give an explicit solution to the rank constrained matrix approximation in Frobenius norm, which is a generalization of the classical approximation of an m by n matrix A by a matrix of rank k at most.

entry.title: Some Remarks on Input Choices for Biochemical Systems
entry.summary: This is a short note with some (very elementary) remarks concerning realization theory and the choice of inputs for identifying systems. Its goal is to bring some of these facts to the attention of the systems biology community.

entry.title: Decision Making: I I I - Incomplete Initial Information
entry.summary: In the item there are presented Interval Structure allow to extend the class of multicriteria decision making problems including incomplete Initial Information. this step will facilitate dada gathering in pairs matching for decision making.

entry.title: Design and Analysis of a Novel $\mathcal{L}_1$ Adaptive Control Architecture with Guaranteed Transient Performance
entry.summary: Novel adaptive control architecture is presented that has guaranteed transient performance for system's both signals, input and output, simultaneously.

entry.title: Some control design experiments with HIFOO
entry.summary: A new MATLAB package called HIFOO was recently proposed for H-infinity fixed-order controller design. This document illustrates how some standard controller design examples can be solved with this software.

entry.title: Rolling balls and Octonions
entry.summary: In this semi-expository paper we disclose hidden symmetries of a classical nonholonomic kinematic model and try to explain geometric meaning of basic invariants of vector distributions.

entry.title: Distances between time-series and their autocorrelation statistics
entry.summary: We begin with an interpretation of the L1-distance between two power spectral densities and then, following an analogous rationale, we develop a natural metric for quantifying distance between respective covariance matrices.

entry.title: Organization of the Modulopt collection of optimization problems in the Libopt environment -- Version 1.0
entry.summary: This note describes how the optimization problems of the Modulopt collection are organized within the Libopt environment. It is aimed at being a guide for using and enriching this collection in this environment.

entry.title: Conjugate points in Euler's elastic problem
entry.summary: For the classical Euler's elastic problem, conjugate points are described. Inflectional elasticae admit the first conjugate point between the first and the third inflection points. All the rest elasticae do not have conjugate points.

entry.title: Convergence of the Min-Sum Algorithm for Convex Optimization
entry.summary: We establish that the min-sum message-passing algorithm and its asynchronous variants converge for a large class of unconstrained convex optimization problems.

entry.title: GloptiPoly 3: moments, optimization and semidefinite programming
entry.summary: We describe a major update of our Matlab freeware GloptiPoly for parsing generalized problems of moments and solving them numerically with semidefinite programming.

entry.title: Casimir operators of Lie algebras with a nilpotent radical
entry.summary: We show that a Lie algebra having a nilpotent radical has a fundamental set of invariants consisting of Casimir operators. We give a different proof of this fact in the special and well-known case where the radical is abelian.

entry.title: Global Stabilization by Means of Discrete-Delay Output Feedback
entry.summary: In the present work, sufficient conditions for global stabilization of nonlinear uncertain systems by means of discrete-delay static output feedback are presented. Illustrating examples show the efficiency of the proposed control strategy.

entry.title: Integer program with bimodular matrix
entry.summary: This paper has been accepted for publication in Discrete Optimization.

entry.title: An Intrinsic Impulse Observability Criterion for Descriptor System
entry.summary: Analyzing the order of unobservable impulse in descriptor system leads to a new testing criterion for impulse observability, both the statement and the proof of which use only the original system data.

entry.title: Lecture notes: Semidefinite programs and harmonic analysis
entry.summary: Lecture notes for the tutorial at the workshop HPOPT 2008 - 10th International Workshop on High Performance Optimization Techniques (Algebraic Structure in Semidefinite Programming), June 11th to 13th, 2008, Tilburg University, The Netherlands.

entry.title: A Transformation of the Control under Uncertainty Problems
entry.summary: The game theoretical approach problem is considered. If goal set is controllability set of auxiliary control system then the original problem can be transformed into the problem of approach "at the moment".

entry.title: The Analytical Solution of the Lag-Lead Compensator
entry.summary: In this paper, we first give the analytical solution of the general lag-lead compensator design problem. Then, we show why a series of more than 5 phase-lead/phase-lag compensator cannot be solved analytically using the Galois Theory.

entry.title: On the Duality Theory for the Monge--Kantorovich Transport Problem
entry.summary: The paper is accompanying "A general Duality Theorem for the Monge-Kantorovich Transport Problem". We explain the methods used in this article in an elementary setting and present two examples complementing the results obtained therein.

entry.title: On some systems controlled by the structure of their memory
entry.summary: We consider an optimal control problem governed by an ODE with memory playing the role of a control. We show the existence of an optimal solution and derive some necessary optimality conditions. Some examples are then discussed.

entry.title: On a zero duality gap result in extended monotropic programming
entry.summary: In this note we correct and improve a zero duality gap result in extended monotropic programming given by Bertsekas in [1].

entry.title: An abstract Nyquist criterion containing old and new results
entry.summary: We prove an abstract Nyquist criterion in a general set up. As applications, we recover various versions of the Nyquist criterion, some of which are new.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Mathematical Analysis and its Applications 370 (2010), no. 2, 703-715

entry.title: Extension of the $ν$-metric
entry.summary: We extend the $\nu$-metric introduced by Vinnicombe in robust control theory for rational plants to the case of infinite-dimensional systems/classes of nonrational transfer functions.

entry.title: Decision Making: Superiority Degree
entry.summary: It is introduced the concept of Superiority Degree one competitive decision over another. On the basis of this concept the mathematics theoretic structure is developed, which is part of pairs comparisons branch in modern decision making theory. It will be useful for practice and interesting for scientific research.

entry.title: On the Caratheodory rank of polymatroid bases
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that the Carath\'eodory rank of the set of bases of a (poly)matroid is upper bounded by the cardinality of the ground set.

entry.title: A Benamou-Brenier approach to branched transport
entry.summary: The problem of branched transportation aims to describe the movement of masses when, due to concavity effects, they have the interest to travel together as much as possible, because the cost for a path of length

entry.title: Minimal Perturbations to Roots of Parameterized Equations
entry.summary: The size of minimal perturbations to roots of parameterized equations can be estimated reliably from linearizations of the equations.

entry.title: Generic nondegeneracy in convex optimization
entry.summary: We show that minimizers of convex functions subject to almost all linear perturbations are nondegenerate. An analogous result holds more generally, for lower-C^2 functions.

entry.title: Almost Metric Versions of Zhong's Variational Principle
entry.summary: A refinement of Zhong's variational principle [Nonlin. Anal., 29 (1997), 1421-1431] is given, in the realm of almost metric structures. Applications to equilibrium points are also provided.

entry.title: Nonlinear Control Synthesis for a Self-energizing Electro-Hydraulic Brake
entry.summary: Nonlinear control algorithm for a self-energizing electro-hydraulic brake is analytically designed. The desired closed-loop system behavior is reached via a synthesized nonlinear controller.

entry.title: Optimal control problems with state constraint governed by Navier-Stokes equations
entry.summary: This work deals with the existence of optimal solution and the maximum principle for optimal control problem governed by Navier-Stokes equations with state constraint in 3-D. Strong results in 2-D also are given.

entry.title: On mixed type duality for nondifferentiable multiobjective variational problems
entry.summary: A mixed type dual to a nondifferentiable variational problem involving higher order derivative is formulated and duality results are proved under generalized invexity conditions. Special cases are generated from our results.

entry.title: First order dependence on uncertainty sets in robust optimization
entry.summary: We show that a first order problem can approximate solutions of a robust optimization problem when the uncertainty set is scaled, and explore further properties of this first order problem.

entry.title: An optimal algorithm for stochastic strongly-convex optimization
entry.summary: We consider stochastic convex optimization with a strongly convex (but not necessarily smooth) objective. We give an algorithm which performs only gradient updates with optimal rate of convergence.

entry.title: Matrix Completion by the Principle of Parsimony
entry.summary: Dempster's covariance selection method is extended first to general nonsingular matrices and then to full rank rectangular matrices. Dempster observed that his completion solved a maximum entropy problem. We show that our generalized completions are also solutions of a suitable entropy-like variational problem.

entry.title: Proximity for Sums of Composite Functions
entry.summary: We propose an algorithm for computing the proximity operator of a sum of composite convex functions in Hilbert spaces and investigate its asymptotic behavior. Applications to best approximation and image recovery are described.

entry.title: Second-Order Necessary/Sufficient Conditions for Optimal Control Problems in the Absence of Linear Structure
entry.summary: Second-order necessary conditions for optimal control problems are considered, where the ``second-order" is in the sense of that Pontryagin's maximum principle is viewed as a first-order necessary optimality condition. A sufficient condition for a local minimizer is also given.

entry.title: Symmetry in variational principles and applications
entry.summary: We formulate symmetric versions of classical variational principles. Within the framework of non-smooth critical point theory, we detect Palais-Smale sequences with additional second order and symmetry information. We discuss applications to PDEs, fixed point theory and geometric analysis.

entry.title: A Robust Robust Optimization Result
entry.summary: We study the loss in objective value when an inaccurate objective is optimized instead of the true one, and show that "on average" this loss is very small, for an arbitrary compact feasible region.

entry.title: Optimality Conditions for Bilevel Programming Problem in Asplund Spaces
entry.summary: Here, necessary optimal condition for Optimistic Bilevel programming problem is obtained in Asplund spaces. Also we have got necessary optimal conditions in finite dimensional spaces, by assuming differentiability on the given functions.

entry.title: Model-free control of non-minimum phase systems and switched systems
entry.summary: This brief presents a simple derivation of the standard model-free control for the non-minimum phase systems. The robustness of the proposed method is studied in simulation considering the case of switched systems.

entry.title: Null-Control and Measurable Sets
entry.summary: We prove the interior and boundary null-controllability of some parabolic evolutions with controls acting over measurable sets.

entry.title: On the simultaneous location of a service facility and a rapid transit line
entry.summary: In this paper we provide a finite set of candidates to be one of the endpoints of an optimal solution for the problem of locating simultaneously a service facility and a rapid transit line.

entry.title: Deterministic monotone dynamics and dominated strategies
entry.summary: We survey and unify results on elimination of dominated strategies by monotonic dynamics and prove some new results that may be seen as dual to those of Hofbauer and Weibull (J. Econ. Theory, 1996, 558-573) on convex monotonic dynamics.

entry.title: Extensions and applications of ACF mappings
entry.summary: Using a definition of ASF sequences derived from the definition of asymptotic contractions of the final type of ACF, we give some new fixed points theorem for cyclic mappings and alternating mapping which extend results from T.Suzuki and X.Zhang.

entry.title: On Harrod Neutral Technical Change. Uzawa Revisited
entry.summary: We provide a two line proof of the theorem of Uzawa (1961) that in the classic Solow/Swan growth model, only Harrod neutral (labor augmenting) technical progress is consistent with an equilibrium steady state

entry.title: Algebraic Relaxations and Hardness Results in Polynomial Optimization and Lyapunov Analysis
entry.summary: This thesis settles a number of questions related to computational complexity and algebraic, semidefinite programming based relaxations in optimization and control.

entry.title: Generalized transversality conditions for the Hahn quantum variational calculus
entry.summary: We prove optimality conditions for generalized quantum variational problems with a Lagrangian depending on the free end-points. Problems of calculus of variations of this type cannot be solved using the classical theory.

entry.title: Tropical geometry of PERT
entry.summary: Based on a description of project networks by max-plus algebra and poset, the adjacency of critical paths is presented using tropical geometry.

entry.title: Convex integer minimization in fixed dimension
entry.summary: We show that minimizing a convex function over the integer points of a bounded convex set is polynomial in fixed dimension.

entry.title: Efficient Computation of a Canonical Form for a Generalized P-matrix
entry.summary: We use recent results on algorithms for Markov decision problems to show that a canonical form for a generalized P-matrix can be computed, in some important cases, by a strongly polynomial algorithm.

entry.title: Stochastic maximum principle for optimal control of SPDEs
entry.summary: In this note, we give the stochastic maximum principle for optimal control of stochastic PDEs in the general case (when the control domain need not be convex and the diffusion coefficient can contain a control variable).

entry.title: Simultaneous stabilization, avoidance and Goldberg's constants
entry.summary: This is an exposition for mathematicians of some unsolved problems arising in control theory of linear time-independent systems.

entry.title: On the Lossless Property of a Class of Nonlinear Quantum Systems
entry.summary: In this paper, the physical realizability condition for a specific class of nonlinear quantum systems is related to the lossless property of nonlinear dissipative systems having a specific storage function.

entry.title: Almost Optimal Sublinear Time Algorithm for Semidefinite Programming
entry.summary: We present an algorithm for approximating semidefinite programs with running time that is sublinear in the number of entries in the semidefinite instance. We also present lower bounds that show our algorithm to have a nearly optimal running time.

entry.title: Some Sufficient Conditions for the Controllability of Wave Equations with Variable Coefficients
entry.summary: In this work, we present some easily verifiable sufficient conditions that guarantee the controllability of wave equations with non-constant coefficients. These conditions work as complements for those obtained by Peng-fei Yao in SIAM J. Control Optim.1999

entry.title: Existence and Properties of the State Operator in Dynamic User Equilibrium
entry.summary: In this paper, we establish and prove analytical properties of the state operator embedded in an optimal control problem, in the context of dynamic user equilibrium (DUE) models (Friesz et al. 1993).

entry.title: The asymptotic value in finite stochastic games
entry.summary: We provide a direct, elementary proof for the existence of $\lim_{\lambda\to 0} v_{\lambda}$, where $v_{\lambda}$ is the value of a $\lambda$-discounted finite two-person zero-sum stochastic game.

entry.title: Convex conditions for robust stabilization of uncertain switched systems with guaranteed minimum dwell-time
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Balls minimize trace constants in BV
entry.summary: Balls are shown to have the smallest optimal constant, among all admissible Euclidean domains, in Poincar\'e type boundary trace inequalities for functions of bounded variation with vanishing median or mean value.

entry.title: Matrix Completion and Tensor Rank
entry.summary: In this paper, we show that the low rank matrix completion problem can be reduced to the problem of finding the rank of a certain tensor.

entry.title: Self-concordance is NP-hard
entry.summary: We give an elementary proof of a somewhat curious result, namely, that deciding whether a convex function is self-concordant is in general an intractable problem.

entry.title: Existence of equilibrium for multiobjective games in abstract convex spaces
entry.summary: In this paper we use the minimax inequalities obtained by S. Park (2011) to prove the existence of weighted Nash equilibria and Pareto Nash equilibria of a multiobjective game defined on abstract convex spaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted for publication in Mathematical reports

entry.title: Grushin problems and control theory: Formulation and examples
entry.summary: In this paper we give a new formulation of an abstract control problem in terms of a Grushin problem, so that we will reformulate all notions of controllability, observability and stability in a new form that gives readers an easy interpretation of these notions.

entry.title: Some preconditioners for systems of linear inequalities
entry.summary: We show that a combination of two simple preprocessing steps would generally improve the conditioning of a homogeneous system of linear inequalities. Our approach is based on a comparison among three different but related notions of conditioning for linear inequalities.

entry.title: Automatic parametrization and mesh deformation for CFD optimization
entry.summary: We present an automatic and memory efficient methods of morphing-based parametrization of shapes in CFD optimization. Method is based on Kriging and Radial Basis Function interpolation methods.

entry.title: A necessary and sufficient condition for local controllability around closed orbits
entry.summary: In this paper we give a necessary and sufficient condition for local controllability around closed orbits for general smooth control systems. We also prove that any such system on a compact manifold has a closed orbit.

entry.title: On monotonicity of some functionals under rearrangements
entry.summary: We consider the Polya--Szeg\"o type weighted inequality. We prove this inequality for monotone rearrangement and for Steiner's symmetrization.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages. Russian version of this preprint is published in November 2013 and available at http://www.mathsoc.spb.ru/preprint/2013/index.html

entry.title: On Networks with Active and Passive Agents
entry.summary: We introduce an active-passive networked multiagent system framework, which consists of agents subject to exogenous inputs (active agents) and agents without any inputs (passive agents), and analyze its convergence using Lyapunov stability.

entry.title: Superintegrability of Sub-Riemannian Problems on Unimodular 3D Lie Groups
entry.summary: Left-invariant sub-Riemannian problems on unimodular 3D Lie groups are considered. For the Hamiltonian system of Pontryagin maximum principle for sub-Riemannian geodesics, the Liouville integrability and superintegrability are proved.

entry.title: Dynamic programming using radial basis functions
entry.summary: We propose a discretization of the optimality principle in dynamic programming based on radial basis functions and Shepard's moving least squares approximation method. We prove convergence of the approximate optimal value function to the true one and present several numerical experiments.

entry.title: On Local Convexity of Quadratic Transformations
entry.summary: In this paper, we improve Polyak's local convexity result for quadratic transformations. Extension and open problems are also presented.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Operations Research Society of China, 2:341-350 2014

entry.title: Observations from measurable sets and applications
entry.summary: We find new quantitative estimates on the space-time analyticity of solutions to linear parabolic equations with time-independent coefficients and apply them to obtain observability inequalities for its solutions over measurable sets.

entry.title: Pointwise controllability as limit of internal controllability for the beam equation
entry.summary: This work is devoted to prove the pointwise controllability of the Bernoulli-Euler beam equation. It is obtained as a limit of internal controllability of the same type of equation.

entry.title: A generalized result of output stabilizability
entry.summary: Output stabilizability of a class of infinite dimensional linear systems is studied in this paper. A criterion for the system to be output stabilizable by a linear bounded feedback $u=Fx$, $F\in L(Z,\mathbb{R}^{^{p}})$ will be given.

entry.title: Continuity of Minima: Local Results
entry.summary: This paper compares and generalizes Berge's maximum theorem for noncompact image sets established in Feinberg, Kasyanov and Voorneveld (2014) and the local maximum theorem established in Bonnans and Shapiro (2000).

entry.title: Realization of nonlinear behaviors from organizing centers
entry.summary: Borrowing the concept of organizing center from singularity theory, the paper proposes a methodology to realize nonlinear behaviors such as switches, relaxation oscillators, or bursters from core circuits that reveal the fundamental role of monotonicity and feedback in their robustness and modulation.

entry.title: Fuzzy models for learning assessment
entry.summary: In the current paper a new Trapezoidal Fuzzy Model for Assessment is developed. This model is a variation of a special form of the commonly used in Fuzzy Mathematics Center of Gravity technique.

entry.title: On Burdet and Johnson's Algorithm for Integer Programming
entry.summary: In this paper, some deficiencies of a method proposed by Burdet and Johnson in 1977 for solving integer programming problems are discussed. Examples where the algorithm fails to solve the IP and ways to fix these errors are given.

entry.title: BI - level programming
entry.summary: In this paper, bi-level linear programming problem with multiple objectives at each level in intuitionistic fuzzy environment is studied and solved.

entry.title: Landweber-type operator and its properties
entry.summary: Our aim is to present several properties of a Landweber operator and of a Landweber-type operator. These operators are widely used in methods for solving the split feasibility problem and the split common fixed point problem. The presented properties can be used in proofs of convergence of related algorithms.

entry.title: Isoperimetric problem in H-type groups and Grushin spaces
entry.summary: We study the isoperimetric problem in H-type groups and Grushin spaces, emphasizing a relation between them. We prove existence, symmetry and regularity properties of isoperimetric sets, under a symmetry assumption that depends on the dimension.

entry.title: Risk-Sensitive Mean-Field Type Control under Partial Observation
entry.summary: We establish a stochastic maximum principle (SMP) for control problems of partially observed diffusions of mean-field type with risk-sensitive performance functionals.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1404.1441

entry.title: Approximate Controllability of the Two Trapped Ions System
entry.summary: We prove the approximate controllability of a bilinear Schr\"odinger equation modelling a two trapped ions system. A new spectral decoupling technique is introduced, which allows to analyze the controllability of the infinite-dimensional system through finite-dimensional considerations.

author.name: Esteban Paduro
author.arxiv:affiliation: CMAP, INRIA Saclay - Ile de France

author.name: Mario Sigalotti
author.arxiv:affiliation: CMAP, INRIA Saclay - Ile de France

entry.title: An Evolution Strategy Method for Optimizing Machining Parameters of Milling Operations
entry.summary: In this paper, an evolutionary strategy (ES) method is introduced as an optimization approach to solve problems in the manufacturing area. The ES method is applied to a case study for milling operations. The results show that it can effectively yield good results.

entry.title: Optimal mass transport over bridges
entry.summary: We present an overview of our recent work on implementable solutions to the Schroedinger bridge problem and their potential application to optimal transport and various generalizations.

entry.title: Rescaled Pure Greedy Algorithm for Convex Optimization
entry.summary: We suggest a new greedy strategy for convex optimization in Banach spaces and prove its convergent rates under a suitable behavior of the modulus of uniform smoothness of the objective function.

entry.title: Almost sure convergence of the forward-backward-forward splitting algorithm
entry.summary: In this paper, we propose a stochastic forward-backward-forward splitting algorithm and prove its almost sure weak convergence in real separable Hilbert spaces. Applications to composite monotone inclusion and minimization problems are demonstrated.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1210.2986

entry.title: Discussion: The NoMax Strategy and Correlated Outputs
entry.summary: This is a discussion of the paper "Modeling an Augmented Lagrangian for Improved Blackbox Constrained Optimization," (Gramacy, R.~B., Gray, G.~A., Digabel, S.~L., Lee, H.~K.~H., Ranjan, P., Wells, G., and Wild, S.~M., Technometrics, 61, 1--38, 2015).

entry.title: An Analysis of Dual-Issue Final-Offer Arbitration
entry.summary: We discuss final-offer arbitration where two quantitative issues are in dispute and model it as a zero-sum game. Under reasonable assumptions we both derive a pure strategy pair and show that it is both a local equilibrium and furthermore that it is the unique global equilibrium.

entry.title: Controllability of Linear Systems on Generalized Heisenberg Groups
entry.summary: This paper is devoted to the study of controllability of linear systems on generalized Heisenberg groups. Some general necessary controllability conditions and some sufficient ones are provided. We introduce the notion of decoupled systems, and more precise controllability criteria are stated for them.

entry.title: Convex analysis in groups and semigroups: a sampler
entry.summary: We define convexity canonically in the setting of monoids. We show that many classical results from convex analysis hold for functions defined on such groups and semigroups, rather than only on vector spaces. Some examples and counter-examples are also discussed.

entry.title: Some remarks on convex analysis in topological groups
entry.summary: We discuss some key results from convex analysis in the setting of topological groups and monoids. These include separation theorems, Krein-Milman type theorems, and minimax theorems.

entry.title: Structural Results for Partially Observed Markov Decision Processes
entry.summary: This article provides an introductory tutorial on structural results in partially observed Markov decision processes (POMDPs). Typically, computing the optimal policy of a POMDP is computationally intractable. We use lattice program- ming methods to characterize the structure of the optimal policy of a POMDP without brute force computations.

entry.title: A Method of Advanced Chaos Optimal Search Algorithm
entry.summary: In this paper, the advanced parallel chaos optimal search algorithm is proposed and the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm is verified through the experiment for find out the minimum of several benchmark functions.

entry.title: Bilateral obstacle optimal control Problem
entry.summary: In this work we consider the numerical resolution of the bilateral obstacle optimal control problem given in Bergounioux et al. Where the main feature of this problem is that the control and the obstacle are the same.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning: Stochastic Approximation Algorithms for Markov Decision Processes
entry.summary: This article presents a short and concise description of stochastic approximation algorithms in reinforcement learning of Markov decision processes. The algorithms can also be used as a suboptimal method for partially observed Markov decision processes.

entry.title: Controllability of linear systems on Lie groups with finite semisimple center
entry.summary: In this paper we extend the results on controllability of linear systems obtained in "Controllability of linear systems on solvable Lie groups", from solvable Lie groups to Lie groups with finite semisimple center.

entry.title: On the local exact controllability of micropolar fluids with few controls
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the local exact controllability to special trajectories of the micropolar fluid systems in dimension d = 2 and d = 3. We show that controllability is possible acting only on one velocity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 25 pages, accepted for publication in ESAIM:COCV

entry.title: On weakly sequentially complete Banach spaces
entry.summary: We provide sufficient conditions for a Banach space Y to be weakly sequentially complete. These conditions are expressed in terms of the existence of directional derivatives for cone convex mappings with values in Y .

entry.title: Stochastic optimal control of McKean-Vlasov equations with anticipating law
entry.summary: In this paper, we generalise Pontryagin's stochastic maximum principle to controlled McKean-Vlasov equations with anticipating law. The associated new type of delayed backward equations with implicit terminal condition is studied.

entry.title: On the existence of solutions for a generalized strong vector quasi-equilibrium problem
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider a generalized strong vector quasi-equilibrium problem and we prove the existence of its solutions by using some suxiliary results. One of the established theorems is proved by using an approximation method.

entry.title: Existence and almost everywhere regularity of isoperimetric clusters for fractional perimeters
entry.summary: The existence of minimizers in the fractional isoperimetric problem with multiple volume constraints is proved, together with a partial regularity result.

entry.title: Euler-lagrange equation for a delay variational problem
entry.summary: We establish Euler-Lagrange equations for a problem of Calculus of variations where the unknown variable contains a term of delay on a segment.

entry.title: Conic optimization and complementarity problems
entry.summary: Although the Karush-Kuhn-Tucker conditions suggest a connection between a conic optimization problem and a complementarity problem, it is difficult to find an accessible explicit form of this relationship in the literature. This note will present such a relationship.

entry.title: Structural stability of bang-bang trajectories with a double switching time in the minimum time problem
entry.summary: In this paper we consider the problem of structural stability of strong local optimisers for the minimum time problem in the case when the nominal problem has a bang-bang strongly local optimal control which exhibits a double switch.

entry.title: A remark on the convergence of the Douglas-Rachford iteration in a non-convex setting
entry.summary: Using the construction of a Lyapunov function, it is shown that the Douglas-Rachford iteration with respect to a sphere and a line in $\mathbb R^d$ is robustly $\mathcal{KL}$-stable. This implies a convergence which is stronger than uniform convergence on compact sets.

entry.title: The convergence problem in mean field games with a local coupling
entry.summary: The paper studies the convergence, as $N$ tends to infinity, of a system of $N$ coupled Hamilton-Jacobi equations (the Nash system) when the coupling between the players becomes increasingly singular. The limit equation is a mean field game system with local coupling.

entry.title: Analogue of Pontryagin's maximum principle for multiple integrals minimization problems
entry.summary: The theorem like Pontryagin's maximum principle for multiple integrals is proved. Unlike the usual maximum principle, the maximum should be taken not over all matrices, but only on matrices of rank one. Examples are given.

entry.title: Stable solutions in potential mean field game systems
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of stable solution in mean field game theory: they are locally isolated solutions of the mean field game system. We prove that such solutions exist in potential mean field games and are local attractors for learning procedures.

entry.title: Examples of computation of exact moment dynamics for chemical reaction networks
entry.summary: We review in a unified way results for two types of stochastic chemical reaction systems for which moments can be effectively computed: feedforward networks and complex-balanced networks.

entry.title: Exact solutions for the denoising problem of piecewise constant images in dimension one
entry.summary: In this paper we propose a method to determine explicitly the solution of the total variation denoising problem with an $L^p$ fidelity term, where $p>1$, for piecewise constant initial data in dimension one.

entry.title: Risk-sensitive control of reflected diffusion processes on orthrant
entry.summary: In this article, we prove the existence of optimal risk-sensitive control with state constraints. We use near monotone assumption on the running cost to prove the existence of optimal risk-sensitive control.

entry.title: Estimation of samples relevance by their histograms
entry.summary: The problem of the estimation of relevance to a set of histograms generated by samples of a discrete time process is discussed on the base of the variational principles proposed in the previous paper [5]. Some conditions for dimension reduction of corresponding linear programming problems are presented also.

entry.title: Observability and Controllability of Schrödinger equation with infinite square-well potential
entry.summary: We discuss exact observability of boundary and internal observation of a one-dimensional Schr\"odinger equation on a time dependent domain.

entry.title: Carleman estimates for forward and backward stochastic fourth order Schrödinger equations and their applications
entry.summary: In this paper, we establish the Carleman estimates for forward and backward stochastic fourth order Schr\"{o}dinger equations, on basis of which, we can obtain the observability, unique continuation property and the exact controllability for the forward and backward stochastic fourth order Schr\"{o}dinger equations.

entry.title: A Dynamic Programming Solution to Bounded Dejittering Problems
entry.summary: We propose a dynamic programming solution to image dejittering problems with bounded displacements and obtain efficient algorithms for the removal of line jitter, line pixel jitter, and pixel jitter.
entry.arxiv:comment: The final publication is available at link.springer.com

entry.title: On the spherical convexity of quadratic functions
entry.summary: In this paper we study the spherical convexity of quadratic functions on spherically convex sets. In particular, conditions characterizing the spherical convexity of quadratic functions on spherical convex sets associated to the positive orthants, Lorentz and circular cones are given.

entry.title: Fractional Multidimensional System
entry.summary: The multidimensional ($n$-D) systems described by Roesser model are presented in this paper. These $n$-D systems consist of discrete systems and continuous fractional order systems with fractional order $\nu$, $0<\nu<1$. The stability and Robust stability of such $n$-D systems are investigated.

entry.title: Adaptive Stochastic Mirror Descent for Constrained Optimization
entry.summary: Mirror Descent (MD) is a well-known method of solving non-smooth convex optimization problems. This paper analyzes the stochastic variant of MD with adaptive stepsizes. Its convergence on average is shown to be faster than with the fixed stepsizes and optimal in terms of lower bounds.

entry.title: Realization of Biquadratic Impedance as Five-Element Bridge Networks
entry.summary: This report includes the original manuscript and the supplementary material of "Realization of Biquadratic Impedance as Five-Element Bridge Networks".

entry.title: How to Obtain Desirable Transfer Functions in MIMO Systems Using 2-Degrees of Freedom Controllers Under Internal Stability
entry.summary: This paper summarizes important results useful for controller design of multi-input multi-output systems. The main goal is to characterize the stabilizing controllers that provide a desired response.

entry.title: Lagrangian Multipliers for Presubconvexlike Optimization Problems of Set Valued Functions
entry.summary: In this paper, we discuss scalar Lagrangian multipliers and vector Lagrangian multipliers for constrained set-valued optimization problems. We obtain some necessary conditions, sufficient conditions, as well as necessary and sufficient conditions for the existence of weakly efficient solutions.

entry.title: Warasian Economic Equilibrium Problems in Convex Regions
entry.summary: We define Walrasian economic equilibrium in convex regions. We introduce the definition of strict-proper quasimonotone functions, and derive some necessary and sufficient conditions for the existence and uniqueness of Walrasian equilibrium vectors in convex regions.

entry.title: Minimal Sum of Powered Distances from the Sides of a Triangle
entry.summary: In this paper we apply the KKT conditions for solving inequality constrained nonlinear optimization problems to find the minimal sum of powered distances from the sides of an arbitrary triangle.

entry.title: Nonasymptotic and asymptotic linear convergence of an almost cyclic SHQP Dykstra's algorithm for polyhedral problems
entry.summary: We show that an almost cyclic (or generalized Gauss- Seidel) Dykstra's algorithm which incorporates the SHQP (supporting halfspace- quadratic programming) strategy can achieve nonasymptotic and asymptotic linear convergence for polyhedral problems.

entry.title: Mini-batch stochastic gradient descent with dynamic sample sizes
entry.summary: We focus on solving constrained convex optimization problems using mini-batch stochastic gradient descent. Dynamic sample size rules are presented which ensure a descent direction with high probability. Empirical results from two applications show superior convergence compared to fixed sample implementations.

entry.title: Numerical Algorithm for Optimal Control of Continuity Equations
entry.summary: An optimal control problem for the continuity equation is considered. The aim of a controller is to maximize the total mass within a target set at a given type moment. An iterative numerical algorithm for solving this problem is presented.

entry.title: On the existence of directional derivatives for strongly cone-paraconvex mappings
entry.summary: In the present paper we investigate the existence of directional derivatives for strongly cone-paraconvex mappings. Our result is a counterpart of the theorem of Valadier concerning directional differentiability of cone convex mappings.

entry.title: Conditions for representation of a function of many arguments as the difference of convex functions
entry.summary: There are given conditions for represention of a function of many arguments as the difference of convex functions.

entry.title: On Lagrange multipliers in convex entropy minimization
entry.summary: Based on a characterization of the optimality of a feasible solution of a convex entropy minimization problem, one shows that the feasible solutions obtained using formally the Lagrange multipliers method are optimal.

entry.title: Irreducible and Cyclic Zero-Sum Product Stochastic Games
entry.summary: We study two classes of zero-sum stochastic games with compact action sets and a finite product state space. For irreducible on one side games, we prove the existence of the uniform value. For cyclic games, we prove that the asymptotic value may fail to exist.

entry.title: Lower Bound for Randomized First Order Convex Optimization
entry.summary: We provide an explicit construction and direct proof for the lower bound on the number of first order oracle accesses required for a randomized algorithm to minimize a convex Lipschitz function.

entry.title: How to see waves under the Earth surface (the BC-method for geophysicists)
entry.summary: The BC-method is an approach to inverse problems based on their relations to the boundary control theory. The paper provides a simple and physically transparent description of the method in the case of dynamical inverse data given at a portion of the boundary.

entry.title: A note on quasi-equilibrium problems
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to prove the existence of solutions of quasi-equilibrium problems without any generalized monotonicity assumption. Additionally, we give an application to quasi-optimization problems.

entry.title: Time-Dependent Generalized Nash Equilibrium Problem
entry.summary: We prove an existence result for the time-dependent generalized Nash equilibrium problem under generalized convexity using a fixed point theorem. Furthermore, an application to the dynamic abstract economy is considered.

entry.title: Rank theorem in infinite dimension and lagrange multipliers
entry.summary: We use an extension to the infinite dimension of the rank theorem of the differential calculus to establish a Karush-Huhn-Tucker theorem for optimization problems in Banach spaces. We provide an application to variational problems on bounded processus under equality constraints.

entry.title: Asymptotic amplitudes and cauchy gains: A small-gain principle and an application to inhibitory biological feedback
entry.summary: The notions of asymptotic amplitude for signals, and Cauchy gain for input/output systems, and an associated small-gain principle, are introduced. These concepts allow the consideration of systems with multiple, and possibly feedback-dependent, steady states. A Lyapunov-like characterization allows the computation of gains for state-space systems, and the formulation of sufficient conditions insuring the lack of oscillations and chaotic behaviors in a wide variety of cascades and feedback loops. An application in biology (MAPK signaling) is worked out in detail.
entry.arxiv:comment: Updates and replaces math.OC/0112021 See http://www.math.rutgers.edu/~sontag/ for related work

entry.title: Motion camouflage in three dimensions
entry.summary: We formulate and analyze a three-dimensional model of motion camouflage, a stealth strategy observed in nature. A high-gain feedback law for motion camouflage is formulated in which the pursuer and evader trajectories are described using natural Frenet frames (or relatively parallel adapted frames), and the corresponding natural curvatures serve as controls. The biological plausibility of the feedback law is discussed, as is its connection to missile guidance. Simulations illustrating motion camouflage are also presented. This paper builds on recent work on motion camouflage in the planar setting [1]. [1] E.W. Justh and P.S. Krishnaprasad (2005). "Steering laws for motion camouflage," submitted for publication, (see also arXiv:math.OC/0508023v1).

entry.title: An intrinsic metric for power spectral density functions
entry.summary: We present an intrinsic metric that quantifies distances between power spectral density functions. The metric was derived by the author in a recent arXiv-report (math.OC/0607026) as the geodesic distance between spectral density functions with respect to a particular pseudo-Riemannian metric motivated by a quadratic prediction problem. We provide an independent verification of the metric inequality and discuss certain key properties of the induced topology.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IEEE Signal Processing Letters, vol. 14(8), 561-563, August 2007.

entry.title: Finding maxmin allocations in cooperative and competitive fair division
entry.summary: We consider upper and lower bounds for maxmin allocations of a completely divisible good in both competitive and cooperative strategic contexts. We then derive a subgradient algorithm to compute the exact value up to any fixed degree of precision.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, 3 figures. This third version improves the overll presentation; Optimization and Control (math.OC), Computer Science and Game Theory (cs.GT), Probability (math.PR)

entry.title: Some Remarks on Real and Complex Output Feedback
entry.summary: We provide some new necessary and sufficient conditions which guarantee arbitrary pole placement of a particular linear system over the complex numbers. We exhibit a non-trivial real linear system which is not controllable by real static output feedback and discuss a conjecture from algebraic geometry concerning the existence of real linear systems for which all static feedback laws are real.

entry.title: A Tuner that Accelerates Parameters
entry.summary: We propose a tuner, suitable for adaptive control and (in its discrete-time version) adaptive filtering applications, that sets the second derivative of the parameter estimates rather than the first derivative as is done in the overwhelming majority of the literature. Comparative stability and performance analyses are presented.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the 32nd Conference on Information Systems and Sciences, Princeton NJ USA, March 1998. Princeton University

entry.title: Zero Assignment, Pole Placement and Matrix Extension Problems: A Common Point of View
entry.summary: The paper studies a general inverse eigenvalue problem which contains as special cases many well studied pole placement and matrix extension problems. It is shown that the studied problem corresponds on the geometric side to a central projection from some projective variety. The degree for this variety is computed in the critical dimension.

entry.title: Games, predictions, interactivity
entry.summary: This short note is devoted to the unraveling of the hidden interactivity of ordinary games which is an artefact of predictions of the behaviour of other players by the fixed player and describes deviations of their real behaviour from such predictions. A method to improve the predictions is proposed. Applications to the strategical analysis of interactive games are also briefly specified.

entry.title: Computation of maximal reachability submodules
entry.summary: A new and conceptually simple procedure is derived for the compu- tation of the maximal reachability submodule of a given submodule of the state space of a linear discrete time system over a Noethenian ring R. The procedure is effective if R is effective and if kernels and inter- sections can be computed. The procedure is compared with a rather different procedure by Assan e.a. published recently.

entry.title: A Convex Maximization Problem: Discrete Case
entry.summary: We study a specific convex maximization problem in n-dimensional space. The conjectured solution is proved to be a vertex of the polyhedral feasible region, but only a partial proof of local maximality is known. Integer sequences with interesting patterns arise in the analysis, owing to the number theoretic origin of the problem.

entry.title: Matching and digital control implementation for underactuated systems
entry.summary: This note describes two problems related to the digital implementation of control laws in the infinite dimensional family of matching control laws, namely state estimation and sampled data induced error. The entire family of control laws is written for an inverted pendulum cart. Numerical simulations which include sampled data and a state estimator are presented for one of the control laws in this family.

entry.title: Characterization of Local Configuration Controllability for a Class of Mechanical Systems
entry.summary: We investigate local configuration controllability for mechanical control systems within the affine connection formalism. Extending the work by Lewis for the single-input case, we are able to characterize local configuration controllability for systems with $n$ degrees of freedom and $n-1$ input forces.

entry.title: On shape optimization and the Pompeiu problem
entry.summary: The Pompeiu problem is considered as shape optimization problem. We show stability of the ball which is the minimum point of related domain functional. The proof is based on shape derivative method. Stability of the ball for general domain functionals invariant under the rigid motions is discussed.

entry.title: Integral-Input-Output to State Stability
entry.summary: A notion of detectability for nonlinear systems is discussed. Within the framework of ``input to state stability'' (ISS), a dual notion of ``output to state stability'' (OSS), and a more complete detectability notion, ``input-output to state stability'' (IOSS) have appeared in the literature. This note addresses a variant of the IOSS property, using an integral norm to measure signals, as opposed to the standard supremum norm that appears in ISS theory.

entry.title: On the Boundary Control of Systems of Conservation Laws
entry.summary: The paper is concerned with the boundary controllability of entropy weak solutions to hyperbolic systems of conservation laws. We prove a general result on the asymptotic stabilization of a system near a constant state. On the other hand, we give an example showing that exact controllability in finite time cannot be achieved, in general.

entry.title: A Small-Gain Theorem with Applications to Input/Output Systems, Incremental Stability, Detectability, and Interconnections
entry.summary: A general ISS-type small-gain result is presented. It specializes to a small-gain theorem for ISS operators, and it also recovers the classical statement for ISS systems in state-space form. In addition, we highlight applications to incrementally stable systems, detectable systems, and to interconnections of stable systems.

entry.title: Flow Stability of Patchy Vector Fields and Robust Feedback Stabilization
entry.summary: The paper is concerned with patchy vector fields, a class of discontinuous, piecewise smooth vector fields that were introduced in AB to study feedback stabilization problems. We prove the stability of the corresponding solution set w.r.t. a wide class of impulsive perturbations. These results yield the robusteness of patchy feedback controls in the presence of measurement errors and external disturbances.

entry.title: Asymptotic cauchy gains: Definitions and small-gain principle
entry.summary: A notion of "asymptotic Cauchy gain" for input/output systems, and an associated small-gain principle, are introduced. A Lyapunov-like characterization allows the computation of these gains for state-space systems, and the formulation of sufficient conditions insuring the lack of oscillations and chaotic behaviors in a wide variety of cascades and feedback loops.
entry.arxiv:comment: Preliminary Report. See http://www.math.rutgers.edu/~sontag for related materials

entry.title: Vibrational control in H_infinity problems
entry.summary: We consider the application of the theory of vibrational control to H_infinity-problems. We study the possibility of introduction of high-frequency parametric vibrations in order to decrease the minimal attainable value of the H_infinity-norm. We prove the existence of the stabilizing solution of the Riccati equation with quickly oscillating coefficients. This solution is found using the averaging technique as a series of the small parameter.

entry.title: Robust Performance of A Class of Control Systems
entry.summary: Some Kharitonov-like robust Hurwitz stability criteria are established for a class of complex polynomial families with nonlinearly correlated perturbations. These results are extended to the polynomial matrix case and non-interval D-stability case. Applications of these results in testing of robust strict positive realness of real and complex interval transfer function families are also presented.

entry.title: Adaptation Implies Internal Model
entry.summary: This note provides a simple result showing, under suitable technical assumptions, that if a system S adapts to a class of external signals U, then S must necessarily contain a subsystem which is capable of generating all the signals in U. It is not assumed that regulation is robust, nor is there a prior requirement for the system to be partitioned into separate plant and controller components.

entry.title: A remark on the converging-input converging-state property
entry.summary: Suppose that an equilibrium is asymptotically stable when external inputs vanish. Then, every bounded trajectory which corresponds to a control which approaches zero and which lies in the domain of attraction of the unforced system, must also converge to the equilibrium. This "well-known" but hard-to-cite fact is proved and slightly generalized here.

entry.title: On Bond Portfolio Management
entry.summary: This paper describes a new method of bond portfolio optimization based on stochastic string models of correlation structure in bond returns. The paper shows how to approximate correlation function of bond returns, compute the optimal portfolio allocation using Wiener-Hopf factorization, and check whether a collection of bonds presents arbitrage opportunities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages, extensively revised version, figures are included

entry.title: Complete Solution to the General Robust Strictly Positive Real Synthesis Problem for Polynomial Segments
entry.summary: For any two n-th order polynomials a(s) and b(s), the Hurwitz stability of their convex combination is necessary and sufficient for the existence of a polynomial c(s) such that c(s)/a(s) and c(s)/b(s) are both strictly positive real.
entry.arxiv:comment: In this paper, a long-standing open problem in modern control theory has been constructively resolved

entry.title: Robust Strictly Positive Real Synthesis for Convex Combination of Sixth-Order Polynomials
entry.summary: For the two sixth-order polynomials $a(s)$ and $b(s),$ Hurwitz stability of their convex combination is necessary and sufficient for the existence of a polynomial $c(s)$ such that $c(s)/a(s)$ and $c(s)/b(s)$ are both strictly positive real. Our reasoning method is constructive, and is insightful and helpful in solving the general robust strictly positive real synthesis problem.

entry.title: Robust D-stability of uncertain MIMO systems: LMI criteria
entry.summary: The focal point of this paper is to provide some simple and efficient criteria to judge the ${\cal D}$-stability of two families of polynomials, i.e., an interval multilinear polynomial matrix family and a polytopic polynomial family. Taking advantage of the uncertain parameter information, we analyze these two classes of uncertain models and give some LMI conditions for the robust stability of the two families. Two examples illustrate the effectiveness of our results.

entry.title: Robust Strictly Positive Real Synthesis for Polynomial Families of Arbitrary Order
entry.summary: For any two $n$-$th$ order polynomials $a(s)$ and $b(s),$ the Hurwitz stability of their convex combination is necessary and sufficient for the existence of a polynomial $c(s)$ such that $c(s)/a(s)$ and $c(s)/b(s)$ are both strictly positive real.

entry.title: Multistability in Monotone I/O Systems, Preliminary Report
entry.summary: We extend the setup in our previous paper to deal with the case in which more than one steady state may exist in feedback configurations. This provides a foundation for the analysis of multi-stability and hysteresis behaviour in high dimensional feedback systems.

entry.title: Smoothed analysis of algorithms
entry.summary: Spielman and Teng introduced the smoothed analysis of algorithms to provide a framework in which one could explain the success in practice of algorithms and heuristics that could not be understood through the traditional worst-case and average-case analyses. In this talk, we survey some of the smoothed analyses that have been performed.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 1, 597--606

entry.title: Computing the Integer Programming Gap
entry.summary: We determine the maximal gap between the optimal values of an integer program and its linear programming relaxation, where the matrix and cost function are fixed but the right hand side is unspecified. Our formula involves irreducible decomposition of monomial ideals. The gap can be computed in polynomial time when the dimension is fixed.

entry.title: Enabling Dynamic Process Simulators to Perform Alternative Tasks: A Time-stepper Based Toolkit for Computer-Aided Analysis
entry.summary: We discuss computational superstructures that, using repeated, appropriately initialized short calls, enable temporal process simulators to perform alternative tasks such as fixed point computation, stability analysis and projective integration. We illustrate these concepts through the acceleration of a gPROMS-based Rapid Pressure Swing Adsorption simulation, and discuss their scope and possible extensions.

entry.title: A catalog of inverse-kinematics planners for underactuated systems on matrix groups
entry.summary: This paper presents motion planning algorithms for underactuated systems evolving on rigid rotation and displacement groups. Motion planning is transcribed into (low-dimensional) combinatorial selection and inverse-kinematics problems. We present a catalog of solutions for all underactuated systems on $\SE{2}$, $\SO{3}$ and $\SE{2}\times\real$ classified according to their controllability properties.

entry.title: On the Constancy of the Pontryagin Hamiltonian for Autonomous Problems
entry.summary: We provide a new, simpler, and more direct proof of the well known fact that for autonomous optimal control problems the Pontryagin extremals evolve on a level surface of the respective Pontryagin Hamiltonian.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Journal of Applied Mathematics & Statistics (IJAMAS), June 2006, Vol. 4, No. J06, pp. 23-24.

entry.title: The structured distance to ill-posedness for conic systems
entry.summary: An important measure of conditioning of a conic linear system is the size of the smallest structured perturbation making the system ill-posed. We show that this measure is unchanged if we restrict to perturbations of low rank. We thereby derive a broad generalization of the classical Eckart-Young result characterizing the distance to ill-posedness for a linear map.

entry.title: Convolutional Codes of Goppa Type
